antiPatterns.name: Ambiguous Interface
antiPatterns.description: The interface of a service offers a single and very general operation.
antiPatterns.detection: A service implements a large amount of functionality, but provides only one public operation to invoke all of it. Accepted requests are internally forwarded to various methods.
antiPatterns.consequences: Analyzability and understandability are reduced, because the service does not publish all its provided functionality in a clear manner. Therefore, a user has to analyze the implementation of the service before using it.
antiPatterns.cause: May easily appear in pub-sub systems, where interactions are not explicitly modeled and multiple services exchange event messages via a shared event bus.
antiPatterns.solution: Split the single generic operation into multiple more specialized operations.
antiPatterns.example: Interface with a single public operation that takes a generic type as parameter.
